page.title: 02BRIGHSTONE VILLAGE
page.content: Brighstone village is small but pretty. The shops are not very big and are spread out along the main street.They sell the everyday things that locals would need.There are three shops and a Post Office. It has a public house called "The Three Bishops" because three rectors of Brighstone went on to become bishops. Its original name was "New Inn" ,this can still be seen written in the actual bricks. The village has a church and a church hall. It also has a primary school, a doctor's surgery and an Old People's Home not far out of the village.There is an active parish council. The village has 35% of its poulation over retirment age, although there are many young people too. It is a friendly place to live in as everyone cares about everyone else.
